First Interesting Question
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Card & Adventure Video Games: Monster Rancher Battlecard Episode II Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): First Interesting Question
By John Hawley on Thursday, August 3, 2000 - 11:00 am:

While the PlateS(?) shows only 24 slots, when you check your cards it shows 43 slots for what I think is the Monsters section. Is the Plates section only for Pures or will we be graced with another Plate somewhere along the way? Any thoughts?

By Farmer Jimbo on Thursday, August 3, 2000 - 11:07 am:

I think the extra slots in the card section are for mixed breed monsters (Tiger/Hare). The manual seems to suggest that Main breed is for the attacks and the Sub breed is for defense moves like dodge and block. Does that make sense?

By John Hawley on Thursday, August 3, 2000 - 11:47 am:

Still leaves the mystery of why it's Plates, not Plate. And the manual doesn't suggest it. Mine flat out says Main for Attacks and Sub for Defense. Some how i don't see this as a good thing. Take a Leafy (or whatever their calling it) - Tiger/Plant. Tiger attacks, but PLant's Take The Hit defense? That could be an owie if it has Tigers Life.

By Farmer Jimbo on Thursday, August 3, 2000 - 12:37 pm:

I'm guessing here, but the Tiger/Plant should have a life number in between the tiger and plant (8 or 9). The Tiger/Plant can use the tiger's attack skill cards and the plant's dodge and block skill cards. The advantage would depend on what skill cards you have access to for both monsters. Since I'm really only one day into this, I have no idea if this is good or bad in my case.

As to why plate is plural rather than singular, heck if I know. It’s a good question.

By Foster on Thursday, August 3, 2000 - 10:00 pm:

By John Hawley on Thursday, August 3, 2000 - 11:41 pm:

Gotta correct myself Here. Plate only shows 20 slots, not 24.
